Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.drive_interface_speed.drive_interface_speed

# Copyright (c) 2016-present, Facebook, Inc.
# All rights reserved.
#
# Description     : This test compares the drive's interface speed with
#                   the expected input speed value.
# TestCase IDs    : UHDDT_002
# ==============================================================================
from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.storage_test_base import StorageTestBase



[docs]class DriveInterfaceSpeed(StorageTestBase):
    """Drive Interface Speed Test.

    This test gets all the drives available in the host based on drive type,
    gets the interface speed for each drive and verifies the test parameter
    speed value present in available drives interface speed list.

    Parameters
    ----------
    test_drives : :obj:`list` of :obj:`str`
        All drives present in the host.
    spec_link_speed : String
        Expected link speed of drives being tested
    """


[docs]    def execute(self):
        """Validates Drive's Interface Speed.

        This method gets all the drives on the host based on the drive type
        & drive interface and calculates the link speed if test parameter
        isn't provided.

        Gets the Interface speed for each drive and validates whether the
        expected test parameter Interface speed is present in the Drive's
        Interface speed list.

        Raises
        ------
        TestStepError
            When comparison fails between expected and actual values of
            Drive's Interface Speed.
        TestError
            When fails to find the
                - Interface Speed field from SMARTCTL command for SATA Interface.
                - C:B:T Address from symlink for SAS Interface.
        """
        self.log_info("Begin checking drive interface speed")

        # Get link speed of the first drive if test parameter isn't provided
        spec_link_speed = self.test_control.get(
            "spec_link_speed",
            self.test_drives[0].get_interface_speed()
        )

        for drive in self.test_drives:
            speed = drive.get_interface_speed()

            self.validate_in(
                spec_link_speed,
                speed,
                "Verify /dev/%s link speed." % drive.block_name
            )
        self.log_info("Finished checking drive interface speed.")




[docs]def main():
    test = DriveInterfaceSpeed()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
